item.title: 土耳其航空公司与空中客车公司和波音公司洽谈购买 235 架飞机事宜
item.description: 土耳其航空公司董事长艾哈迈德-博拉特（Ahmet Bolat）周一表示，土耳其航空公司正在与空中客车公司和波音公司谈判购买 235 架飞机的事宜，作为其扩张计划的一部分。【原文：Turkish Airlines is negotiating with both Airbus and Boeing about buying 235 aircraft as part of its expansion plans, Chairman Ahmet Bolat said on Monday.】

item.title: 富尔顿金融公司收购倒闭的共和第一银行存款和资产后业绩大增
item.description: 富尔顿金融公司（Fulton Financial）从联邦存款保险公司（Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation）手中收购了 Republic First 的存款和资产，这是 2024 年美国第一家倒闭的银行，之后该公司股价周一大涨。【原文：Fulton Financial's shares jumped on Monday after it bought the deposits and assets of Republic First from the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, in what is the first U.S. bank failure of 2024.】

item.title: 尽管经济不景气，但中国人在尿布和高露洁上的花费仍在增加
item.description: 据尿布和一些高露洁牙膏制造商的高管透露，尽管消费者对中国的房地产危机和不景气的经济感到担忧，但中国购物者在这些产品上的花费还是略有增加。【原文：Chinese shoppers are spending a little more on diapers and some Colgate toothpastes, according to executives at the makers of these products, even as consumers fret about the country's property crisis and faltering economy.】

item.title: 美联储按兵不动，通胀推迟软着陆进程
item.description: 通货膨胀近期没有放缓或范围缩小的迹象，这让美国联邦储备委员会（Federal Reserve）的政策制定者们本周面临着如何描述他们下一步行动的挑战，即使在充满争议的美国总统大选进入倒计时之际。【原文：Inflation showing no recent sign of slowing or narrowing in scope leaves U.S. Federal Reserve policymakers challenged this week over how to characterize their next steps even as the countdown to a contentious U.S. presidential election continues.】

item.title: 多米诺比萨订单增加，销售额超出预期
item.description: 周一，多米诺比萨第一季度同店销售额超出华尔街预期，原因是美国消费者对该比萨连锁店新推出的忠诚度计划和其他促销活动青睐有加。【原文：Domino's Pizza topped Wall Street expectations for first-quarter same-store sales on Monday, as consumers in the United States tapped into the pizza chain's spruced-up loyalty program and other promotional offerings.】

item.title: 数千名酒店员工将在合同谈判前在 18 个城市集会
item.description: 要求大幅加薪的酒店工会工人将于五一节在美国和加拿大的 18 个城市举行集会，届时将与运营商万豪国际集团、希尔顿全球控股公司和凯悦酒店集团展开谈判。【原文：Unionized hotel workers demanding significant pay raises will rally on May Day in 18 U.S. and Canadian cities, as talks are beginning with operators Marriott International , Hilton Worldwide Holdings and Hyatt Hotels Corp .】

item.title: 美联储即将做出裁决，大盘股延续涨势，期指寸步难行
item.description: 美国股指期货周一走高，特斯拉和苹果领涨大型股公司，同时市场等待美联储本周晚些时候的利率决定。【原文：U.S. stock index futures edged higher on Monday as Tesla and Apple led gains in megacap companies while markets awaited the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision later in the week.】

item.title: 早间竞价：美联储主导的繁忙一周：日元从 1 美元兑 160 日元反弹
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 欧盟称苹果 iPadOS 被指定为欧盟技术规则的把关人
item.description: 欧盟反垄断监管机构周一指定苹果公司的 iPad 操作系统为该集团具有里程碑意义的技术规则中的 "守门人"，必须履行严格的义务，以确保为竞争对手提供公平的竞争环境，并为用户提供更多选择。【原文：EU antitrust regulators on Monday designated Apple's operating system for iPads as a gatekeeper under the bloc's landmark tech rules subject to strict obligations aimed at ensuring a level playing field for rivals and more choices for users.】

item.title: 美国汽车监管机构开始对福特野马 Mach-E 汽车进行初步评估
item.description: 周一，美国汽车监管机构开始对约 130,050 辆福特野马 Mach-E 汽车进行初步评估，因为有报告称这些汽车与道路上的固定车辆相撞。【原文：The U.S auto regulator opened a preliminary evaluation into about 130,050 Ford Mustang Mach-E vehicles on Monday over reports of the cars colliding with in-road stationary vehicles.】

item.title: 日元兑美元因疑似干预而跳涨
item.description: 周一，日元兑美元汇率突然跳涨，交易商称日本当局采取了日元买入干预措施，试图支撑在三十多年前的水平上徘徊不前的日元。【原文：The yen jumped suddenly against the dollar on Monday, with traders citing yen-buying intervention by Japanese authorities to try to underpin a currency languishing at levels last seen over three decades ago.】

item.title: 消息人士称，必和必拓顾问正在就盎格鲁竞购方案的改进征求投资者意见
item.description: 消息人士称，必和必拓390亿美元竞购英美资源集团（Anglo American）的顾问正在征求部分股东的意见，因为该矿商在其最初报价上周被拒绝后，正在权衡提出修订报价。【原文：An adviser to BHP on its $39 billion Anglo American bid is seeking views from some of its shareholders as the miner weighs making a revised offer after its initial proposal was rejected last week, sources said.】

item.title: 中国农业银行第一季度利润下降 1.63
item.description: 中国农业银行（AgBank）周一公布第一季度净利润下降 1.63%。【原文：Agricultural Bank of China Ltd (AgBank) reported a 1.63% fall in first-quarter net profit on Monday.】

item.title: 中国将延长部分美国产品进口关税豁免至11月30日
item.description: 中国财政部在周一的一份声明中表示，中国将把对部分美国产品的进口关税豁免延长至11月30日。【原文：China will extend tariff exemptions for imports of some U.S. products until Nov. 30, the finance ministry said in a statement on Monday.】

item.title: 解说：什么是特斯拉全自动驾驶及其在中国推出的原因
item.description: 据一位知情人士透露，特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）于周日抵达北京，进行了一次未事先宣布的访问，预计他将在北京讨论全自动驾驶（FSD）软件的推广以及允许向海外传输数据的问题。【原文：Tesla CEO Elon Musk arrived in Beijing on Sunday on an unannounced visit, where he was expected to discuss the rollout of Full Self-Driving (FSD) software and permission to transfer data overseas, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 解说员：困扰德意志银行邮政银行部门的三大问题
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank）警告说，一场旷日持久的诉讼声称其为邮政银行支付的费用过低，这可能会使德国最大的贷款机构损失高达 13 亿欧元（13.9 亿美元）。【原文：Deutsche Bank has warned a protracted lawsuit claiming it underpaid for Postbank could cost Germany's largest lender up to 1.3 billion euros ($1.39 billion).】

item.title: Blackstone 在对 Hipgnosis 的 16 亿美元收购战中击败 Concord
item.description: Blackstone 已同意以约 15.7 亿美元的价格收购 Hipgnosis Songs Fund，此前这家私募股权投资巨头在夏奇拉和红辣椒等歌手的音乐所有者的收购战中击败了竞争对手 Concord。【原文：Blackstone has agreed to acquire Hipgnosis Songs Fund for about $1.57 billion, after the private equity giant outbid rival suitor Concord in the takeover battle for the music owner of artists such as Shakira and Red Hot Chili Peppers.】

item.title: 邮政银行发布公告后，德意志银行盘前交易下跌 4.9
item.description: 德意志银行股价在周一盘前交易中下跌 4.9%，此前有消息称，这家德国最大的贷款机构可能要在一场长达数年的诉讼中承担高达 13 亿欧元（约合 13.9 亿美元）的赔偿责任，该诉讼声称德意志银行在收购邮政银行时支付的费用过低。【原文：Deutsche Bank shares were 4.9% lower in premarket trade on Monday after news that Germany's largest lender could be on the hook for up to 1.3 billion euros ($1.39 billion) in a yearslong lawsuit claiming it underpaid in its purchase of Postbank.】

item.title: 农用化学品公司先正达第一季度销售和盈利大幅下降
item.description: 种子和农药生产商先正达公司周一表示，该公司第一季度的销售额和利润大幅下降，而就在几周前，这家瑞士公司刚刚搁置了 100 亿美元的上市计划。【原文：Seeds and pesticides maker Syngenta suffered big drops in first quarter sales and profit, the company said on Monday, just a few weeks after the Swiss company shelved its plans for a $10 billion flotation.】

item.title: 维旺迪称正在对计划中的分拆进行可行性研究
item.description: 法国媒体集团维旺迪（Vivendi）周一表示，将其业务拆分为四家独立公司的可行性研究正在取得进展。【原文：French media conglomerate Vivendi said on Monday that a feasibility study for the plan to split its business into four separate companies was progressing.】

item.title: 中国 4 月份工厂活动扩张速度可能放缓
item.description: 路透社周一的一项民意调查显示，中国 4 月份制造业活动的扩张速度可能有所放缓，这表明中国庞大的工厂部门可能在第二季度初失去了一些动力。【原文：China's manufacturing activity in April likely expanded at a slower pace, a Reuters poll showed on Monday, indicating the country's sprawling factory sector may have lost some momentum at the start of the second quarter.】

item.title: 中国房地产股因刺激政策希望而反弹
item.description: 中国房地产开发商的股票周一上涨，原因是市场猜测本周可能会出台更多刺激措施，以清理库存、促进销售和取消购房限制。【原文：Shares of Chinese property developers rallied on Monday on speculation more stimulus measures are likely to be unveiled this week aimed at clearing inventory, boosting sales and lifting home purchase restrictions.】

item.title: Blackstone 旗下的皇冠度假村将裁员多达 1,000 人，挑战日益严峻
item.description: Blackstone 旗下的皇冠度假村（Crown Resorts）周一表示，由于疲软的经济形势继续影响其业务，且该公司正努力履行监管义务，因此将在墨尔本、珀斯和悉尼削减多达 1,000 个职位。【原文：Blackstone-owned Crown Resorts will cut up to 1,000 roles in Melbourne, Perth and Sydney, it said on Monday, as weak economic conditions continue to impact its business and as it struggles to keep up with regulatory obligations.】

item.title: 飞利浦就呼吸机召回事件在美国支付 11 亿美元和解费
item.description: 荷兰医疗设备制造商飞利浦公司周一表示，已同意支付 11 亿美元，以解决美国与全球召回用于治疗睡眠呼吸暂停症的呼吸机有关的人身伤害案件。【原文：Dutch medical devices maker Philips said on Monday it had agreed to pay $1.1 billion in a settlement of personal injury cases in the United States related to the global recall of ventilators used to treat sleep apnea.】

item.title: 4 月份韩国芯片主导的出口增长将加快
item.description: 路透社周一的一项民意调查显示，由于芯片销售强劲，韩国 4 月份的出口预计将以更快的速度增长，连续第七个月扩大涨幅。【原文：South Korea's exports are expected to have risen at a faster pace in April, extending gains for a seventh straight month on strong chip sales, a Reuters poll showed on Monday.】

item.title: OpenAI 的 ChatGPT 成为奥地利隐私投诉的目标
item.description: 微软支持的初创公司OpenAI周一发现自己成了倡导组织NOYB的隐私投诉目标，原因是OpenAI的生成式人工智能聊天机器人ChatGPT提供的错误信息可能违反了欧盟的隐私规则，而OpenAI却没有对这些信息进行修复。【原文：Microsoft-backed startup OpenAI on Monday found itself the target of a privacy complaint by advocacy group NOYB for allegedly not fixing incorrect information provided by its generative AI chatbot ChatGPT that may breach EU privacy rules.】

item.title: 市场：经济意外扰乱了市场最喜爱的衰退预测指标
item.description: 过去曾可靠预测美国经济衰退的一种债券市场异常现象，今年可能会以一种极不寻常的方式正常化。这令市场担忧。【原文：A bond market anomaly that has reliably predicted a U.S. recession in the past may normalize this year in a highly unusual manner. It's a worry for markets.】

item.title: 菲利浦-莫里斯公司在美国推动加热烟草面临关键考验
item.description: 分析师和投资者表示，菲利普-莫里斯国际公司在美国的加热烟草目标是可以实现的，尽管竞争对手认为在一个电子烟占主导地位的市场中，加热烟草的潜力有限。【原文：Philip Morris International's goals for heated tobacco in the United States are reachable, analysts and investors say, even though rivals see limited potential in a market where vaping dominates.】

item.title: 法庭文件显示，壳牌每年从美国原油交易中获利 10 亿美元
item.description: 壳牌庞大的石油和天然气贸易业务的财务细节是该公司最不为人知的秘密。不过，一名前雇员提起的诉讼中的文件显示，壳牌在美国的原油交易每年定期赚取约 10 亿美元。【原文：Financial details of Shell's vast oil and gas trading business are some of the company's closest-held secrets. Documents in a lawsuit filed by a former employee, however, revealed its U.S. crude trading regularly earns around $1 billion every year.】

item.title: 出口强劲，台湾第一季度经济增长 5.6%：路透社民调
item.description: 路透社周一的一项民意调查显示，台湾依赖贸易的经济在第一季度可能会加速增长，原因是对人工智能（AI）应用技术的需求向好，从而支撑了出口反弹。【原文：Taiwan's trade-dependent economy likely grew faster in the first quarter, supported by a rebound in exports amid upbeat demand for the technology that powers artificial intelligence (AI) applications, a Reuters poll showed on Monday.】
